RECORD.TEXT: 162897541 BH 8939200 026215 8/12/2003 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed Report Status : Signed SIAYUDE LARI AGACHJESCTLANDSTONGE UNIT NUMBER : 033-62-04 ADMISSION DATE : 08/12/2003 DISCHARGE DATE : DICTATING PHYSICIAN : Nabeth Glyncred , M.D. ATTENDING PHYSICIAN : Riode Zetllille , M.D. PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Mesenteric ischemia . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Exploratory laparotomy on 8/13/03 . HISTORY AND REASON FOR HOSPITALIZATION : The patient is a 76-year-old , female , who was transferred from a rehab hospital with worsening abdominal pain , with known chronic abdominal ischemia . She now presents with worsening abdominal pain . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : Levofloxacin , Flagyl , Prevacid , Calcium , Reglan , Dulcolax . The patient has no known drug allergies . Showed a cachectic female who was afebrile . She was 80/50 , heart rate 80 , breathing 16 times a minute and sating at 93% on room air . She was somewhat uncomfortable although awake and talkative in bed . Her lungs were clear . Her heart was regular . Abdomen was distended with decreased bowel sounds . She was soft and slightly tender to palpation but no evidence of peritonitis . LABORATORY EVALUATION ON ADMISSION : Showed a white count of 40,000 . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted on 8/12/03 . She was resuscitated with fluids . She was monitored closely overnight with a cardiac monitor and on 8/13/03 , in the morning , she was brought to the operating room where she underwent exploratory laparotomy . Because of this , her abdomen was closed . She was brought to the intensive care unit for comfort measures only , and her family was informed and agreed to the decision . At approximately 4:06 p.m. on 8/13/03 , she was pronounced dead . CONDITION ON DISCHARGE : Dead . The medical examiner has been notified .
